alert.note: Alert for Johnson; Washington; Wilkinson (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 04 at 8:44PM EST until January 07 at 5:00AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia... Oconee River near Oconee affecting Wilkinson, Washington and Johnson Counties. For the Oconee River Basin...including Oconee...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH LATE THURSDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Oconee River near Oconee. * WHEN...From late tonight to early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, The water level begins to flood portions of the dirt parking lot area near the Old Balls Ferry Road boat ramp...just upstream and rightbank from the Georgia Highway 57 bridge. Minor flooding continues in the woodlands near the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 16.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 17.8 feet Thursday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.8 feet on 12/26/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
